content: back loop stitches you will get a more stable square if you can take in the third loop at the same time finishing a round with an invisible join will give a much neater effect than a slip_stitch most rounds start with a standing stitch unless marked otherwise and i have not stated that on individual rounds if you find these hard use a slip_stitch and appropriate number of chains as a substitute round 1 with yarn a form magic_ring 10 single_crochet in ring join with invisible join to 1st single_crochet finish off pull up ring to leave a small centre hole 1 cm do not pull up completely yet and leave 10 cm starting tail 10 single_crochet round 2 remember the flo st you will need the back loops later with yarn b spsc into centre ring skip single_crochet under spsc flo single_crochet in next single_crochet x 5 slip_stitch to 1st spsc to join do not finish off 5 single_crochet 5 spsc round 3 pull up loop starting in same st single_crochet chain 4 skip single_crochet x 5 slip_stitch to 1st st to join finish off still leave centre ring slightly loose to make life easier 5 single_crochet 5 chain-4 round 4 worked into the unused back loops of round 1 with yarn a working behind rounds 2 and 3 3 blo double_crochet in round 1 single_crochet skip single_crochet x 5 sl to 1st double_crochet to join do not finish off but pull up starting ring and sew end in 15 double_crochet serpent star copyright lettice rose 2024 round 5 working behind round 3 chains 2 double_crochet in 1st double_crochet of a group of 3 2 double_crochet in next st double_crochet in next st and round 3 chain-4 double_crochet in same st behind round 3 x 5 slip_stitch to 1st double_crochet to join finish off 30 double_crochet round 6 in this round check the position of the low front post trebles which are stitched round the two strands at the very base of the tacking double_crochet of round 5 see the photo in special stitches stitch the blo slip_stitch into the 3rd loop as well for stability pull them nice and tight as they are not stitched into again the tacking dcs are the stitches that enclose the round 4 chain-4s with yarn b slip_stitch blo in tacking double_crochet chain 4 lfptr in same st skip 2 double_crochet slip_stitch blo in next st lfptr in next tacking double_crochet chain 4 skip 2 double_crochet pm in 1st of these skip sts on 1st repeat only x 5 slip_stitch over 1st slip_stitch to join finish off 10 lfptr 10 slip_stitch 10 chain-4 it is vital to get the marker in the right stitch check it is the third round 5 skipped stitch and look at the photo position of hook for starting round 7 round 7 worked entirely in round 5 skip sts some behind some in front of round 6 to outline the little hearts make sure you move beyond
